content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good. It works for reverse and its fun to do in shortest (at 85 rn)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy to understand,  possible short code solution, and a bit tricky with min-max approach. Give a visual expression of the result that help to understand  mistake.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice visual clash! The first case as example helps very much to understand the task, since it gives a good insight in the varying options for min and max.
Good suggestion, can't wait to see it for Clash

Excellent puzzle, good job on it.

I edited some of the text to fix some grammar and clarify some sentences, I hope that is not a problem.

Can't wait to see it in clash.

Great puzzle. 
Not sure about Reverse tho.
127 chars is my best so far.

All sections
* Do you mean "progress"/"progress bar(s)" instead of "progression(s)"? If so, please change the wording as appropriate.

Goal section
* Please add full stops to the first and last sentences.

* Please change "describe" to "describes".

* Please change "refer to" to "denotes".

* Please change "it remains drawed" to "denote it".

* Please mention the use of {{[}} and {{]}} for marking the boundaries of each progress bar.

* You don't have to put an example here, as the Example section shows one already.

Input section
* Please format all line numbers in <<bold>>.
Refer to the example here for your reference:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

* Line 1: Please change "Number" to "An integer".

* Line 2: Please add "An integer" in front of "Width".

* Line 2: Please add the closed bracket.

* Line 3: Please add "3 space-separated integers" in front of the variable names.

* Line 3: Please use consistent variable names (e.g. the variable name "Min Value" is not used elsewhere in the statement).

* Line 3: Please include a description of the three variables.

Output section
* Please format all line numbers in <<bold>>.

Stub generator
* Please use "loop N read min:int value:int max:int" instead of providing a string.

Thanks.

Thanks for your comments.
Corrections done. 
Thanks
Thank you. I've made a few other wording/formatting fixes just now.
